mlogic.algos.struct

Interface BST<Key extends java.lang.Comparable<Key>,Value>

  • Type Parameters:
    Key - Key by which to index and retrieve objects in the tree
    Value - The object of interest
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    BalancedBinarySearchTree, BinarySearchTree

    public interface BST<Key extends java.lang.Comparable<Key>,Value>
    Specifies the methods to be implemented by any Binary Search Tree implementation
    Author:
    Rajaram G

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      BinaryNode<Key,Value> get(Key key)
      Traverses the binary tree using the key, returns the corresponding value if the key is found, or null if the key is not found.
      java.lang.Integer height()
      Returns the height of the tree
      BinaryNode<Key,Value> maximum()
      Returns the right-most node in the tree
      BinaryNode<Key,Value> minimum()
      Returns the left-most node in the tree
      BinaryNode<Key,Value> predecessor(BinaryNode<Key,Value> node)
      Finds a node using the given key and returns the node just to the left of it in the tree.
      void put(Key key, Value value)
      Traverses the binary tree using the key.
      void remove(Key key)
      Traverses the binary tree using the key If key is found, removes the corresponding node wand re-balances the tree.
      java.lang.Integer size()
      Returns the size of the tree
      BinaryNode<Key,Value> successor(BinaryNode<Key,Value> node)
      Finds a node using the given key and returns the node just to the right of it in the tree.
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns a string representing the tree (root and all its descendants)

        void put(Key key,
         Value value)

        value -

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        value

      • remove

        void remove(Key key)
        Traverses the binary tree using the key If key is found, removes the corresponding node wand re-balances the tree. Does nothing if the key is not found.
        Parameters:
        key -

        Returns the right-most node in the tree

      • predecessor

        BinaryNode<Key,Value> predecessor(BinaryNode<Key,Value> node)
        Finds a node using the given key and returns the node just to the left of it in the tree. Returns null if the given key is not found or it is the left most entry in the tree.
        Parameters:
        node -
        Returns:
        predecessor node

      • successor

        BinaryNode<Key,Value> successor(BinaryNode<Key,Value> node)
        Finds a node using the given key and returns the node just to the right of it in the tree. Returns null if the given key is not found or it is the right most entry in the tree.
        Parameters:
        key -
        Returns:
        successor Node containing key and value for successor
